title: Mastering SQL: From Fundamentals to Advanced Applications

units.title: Introduction to SQL and Relational Databases
units.description: This unit provides a foundational understanding of SQL and relational database concepts. Students will learn about the history of SQL, its structure, and the principles of relational databases. By the end of this unit, students will be able to explain the significance of SQL in data management and identify key components of relational databases. Estimated time investment: 1 week.

modules.title: History and Evolution of SQL
modules.description: This module covers the development of SQL from its inception in the 1970s to the latest version, SQL:2023. Students will explore the contributions of key figures and the impact of SQL on database technologies. Learning methodologies include lectures and discussions.

topics.title: The Origins of SQL
topics.description: Students will learn about the creation of SQL by Donald D. Chamberlin and Raymond F. Boyce, including its original name, SEQUEL, and its foundational principles based on the relational model.

topics.title: SQL Standardization and Versions
topics.description: This topic covers the standardization of SQL by ANSI and ISO, detailing the evolution of SQL through various versions and the significance of these changes.

topics.title: SQL in Modern Database Systems
topics.description: Students will explore how SQL is implemented across different database management systems, including compliance challenges and variations in SQL dialects.

modules.title: Fundamental SQL Concepts
modules.description: This module introduces the core components of SQL, including its sublanguages: DQL, DDL, DCL, and DML. Students will learn how to construct basic SQL queries and understand the structure of relational databases. Learning methodologies include hands-on practice and guided exercises.

topics.title: Understanding SQL Sublanguages
topics.description: Students will learn about the four sublanguages of SQL: DQL, DDL, DCL, and DML, and their specific roles in database management.

topics.title: Basic SQL Syntax and Structure
topics.description: This topic covers the basic syntax of SQL statements, including SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE commands, with practical examples.

topics.title: Data Types in SQL
topics.description: Students will explore the various data types supported by SQL, including predefined, constructed, and user-defined types, and their applications.

modules.title: Core SQL Techniques
modules.description: This unit focuses on core SQL techniques for data manipulation and retrieval. Students will learn how to write complex queries, use joins, and aggregate data. Estimated time investment: 1 week.

modules.title: Querying Data with DQL
modules.description: This module delves into Data Query Language (DQL) and its functions. Students will learn how to retrieve data using SELECT statements and apply filtering and sorting techniques. Learning methodologies include practical exercises and real-world scenarios.

topics.title: Constructing SELECT Statements
topics.description: Students will learn how to construct basic and advanced SELECT statements to retrieve data from one or more tables.

topics.title: Filtering and Sorting Data
topics.description: This topic covers the use of WHERE, ORDER BY, and GROUP BY clauses to filter and sort query results effectively.

topics.title: Using Joins to Combine Data
topics.description: Students will explore different types of joins (INNER, LEFT, RIGHT, FULL) and how to use them to combine data from multiple tables.

modules.title: Data Manipulation with DML
modules.description: This module focuses on Data Manipulation Language (DML) and its role in modifying data within a database. Students will learn how to insert, update, and delete records. Learning methodologies include hands-on practice and case studies.

topics.title: Inserting Data into Tables
topics.description: Students will learn how to use the INSERT statement to add new records to tables, including handling constraints.

topics.title: Updating Existing Records
topics.description: This topic covers the UPDATE statement, including how to modify existing records based on specific conditions.

topics.title: Deleting Records from Tables
topics.description: Students will explore the DELETE statement and best practices for safely removing records from a database.

modules.title: Data Control and Security with DCL
modules.description: This module introduces Data Control Language (DCL) and its importance in managing user permissions and security in SQL databases. Students will learn how to grant and revoke access rights. Learning methodologies include discussions and role-playing scenarios.

topics.title: Understanding User Roles and Permissions
topics.description: Students will learn about the concept of user roles in SQL and how permissions affect data access.

topics.title: Granting and Revoking Permissions
topics.description: This topic covers the GRANT and REVOKE statements, including practical examples of managing user access.

modules.title: Advanced SQL Applications
modules.description: This unit explores advanced SQL concepts and applications, including procedural SQL, performance optimization, and integration with other technologies. Estimated time investment: 1 week.

modules.title: Procedural SQL and Extensions
modules.description: This module covers procedural extensions to SQL, such as PL/SQL and T-SQL, enabling students to write complex scripts and stored procedures. Learning methodologies include coding exercises and project work.

topics.title: Introduction to PL/SQL
topics.description: Students will learn the basics of PL/SQL, including its structure and how to create simple procedures.

topics.title: Using Control Structures in SQL
topics.description: This topic covers control structures like loops and conditionals in procedural SQL, enhancing the ability to write complex logic.

topics.title: Creating and Managing Stored Procedures
topics.description: Students will explore how to create, modify, and execute stored procedures in SQL.

modules.title: Performance Optimization Techniques
modules.description: This module focuses on techniques for optimizing SQL queries and database performance. Students will learn about indexing, query execution plans, and best practices for writing efficient SQL. Learning methodologies include analysis of real-world performance issues.

topics.title: Understanding Indexes and Their Use
topics.description: Students will learn about different types of indexes and how they improve query performance.

topics.title: Analyzing Query Execution Plans
topics.description: This topic covers how to read and interpret query execution plans to identify performance bottlenecks.

topics.title: Best Practices for Writing Efficient SQL
topics.description: Students will explore best practices for writing SQL queries that minimize resource usage and maximize performance.

modules.title: Integrating SQL with Other Technologies
modules.description: This module introduces students to integrating SQL with programming languages and frameworks, such as Python and Java. Learning methodologies include hands-on projects and collaborative coding sessions.

topics.title: Using SQL with Python
topics.description: Students will learn how to connect to SQL databases using Python and execute queries programmatically.

topics.title: Integrating SQL with Java Applications
topics.description: This topic covers how to use JDBC to connect Java applications to SQL databases, including practical examples.

topics.title: Exploring SQL in Web Development
topics.description: Students will explore how SQL is used in web applications, including the role of SQL in backend development.
